title.native: ダンベル何キロ持てる？
title.english: How Heavy Are the Dumbbells You Lift?

description:
Hibiki enjoys the finer things in life, and when it comes to food, she's downright indulgent. When it becomes clear she's getting chubby, she decides to better herself by joining a gym.
In her attempt to find a casual gym, she meets Akemi - a comrade-in-arms. Little does Hibiki know, Akemi has an ulterior motive.

What will this wonderful world of fitness have in store for Hibiki?
synonyms: How Many Kilograms are the Dumbbells You Lift?
แก๊งสาวป่วน ก๊วนฟิตเนส

node.description:
__Height:__ 159 cm

__[Profile (Raccoon Dog)](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r12-fai.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fairouzzzzzz) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fairouz_ai/) |  [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ai_Fairouz) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ファイルーズあい)__

Japanese voice actress affiliated with Mausu Promotion (formerly Raccoon Dog).

Fairouz was born to a Japanese mother and an Egyptian father. She was named after the Lebanese singer, Fairuz. She spent a few years of her elementary education in Cairo before returning to Japan. During her junior high school years, she became familiar with the manga series [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/manga/31517/). Due to her growing interest in the series, she would join Skype reading sessions with other fans. Eventually, she was inspired to pursue a career in voice acting, but her parents initially disapproved of her plans. Instead, she would initially study at a graphic design vocational school before spending a year as a dental assistant. Once she was able to save enough money for tuition, she enrolled in a voice acting training school.

In 2019, she debuted as [Hibiki Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/132856/), the protagonist of the anime series [How Heavy Are the Dumbbells You Lift?](https://anilist.co/anime/107226/)

In a Twitter post on 31st December 2024 she announced her indefinite hiatus from voice acting due to health complications surrounding PTSD. On April 1st, she announced she would be returning from hiatus, and that she would be leaving Raccoon Dog for talent agency Mausu Promotion.

__Awards:__
- Best New Actress at the 14th Seiyuu Awards in 2020 for her role as [Hibiki Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/132856/Hibiki-Sakura).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Belorta - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Soldier FA - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ayre - Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon (VG)
- Iono - Pokémon Masters EX (VG)
- Eternity - Reverse 1999 (VG)
- Xilonen - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Catherina Grann - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Aikiyo Fuuka - Blue Archive (VG)

__Height:__ 174 cm

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/ishikawa-kaito/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ish_kaito) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/apatyai1013) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ishi_kaito1013/)

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Marius von Hagen (Tears of Themis)
• Il Fado de Rie (Cafe Enchante)
• Adam (Bustafellows)
• Lucien Neuschburn (even if Tempest)
• Laurier (Nekopara -Catboys Paradise-)

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
ADR Engineer at FUNimation Entertainment, however has since expanded to also being a Mixing Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mnk_jenkinsc)

Ayato Shinozaki is a Japanese DJ, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of the rock band [HigedriveVAN](https://twitter.com/higedrivan).
